name: HIP 38594
scenarioDescription:
The HIP 38594 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HIP 38594 is a star with 0.61 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located NaN light years away from the solar system.

HIP 38594 is known to have undefined exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HIP 38594 system


HIP 38594 b

HIP 38594 b was discovered by the undefined observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.26 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HIP 38594 b is 8.10582 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HIP 38594 b is 2.77 that of Earth. At 8.10582 Earth masses, HIP 38594 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses. With a mass of 8.10582 Earth masses and a semi-major axis of 0.256 astronomical units, HIP 38594 b could, potentially, be a habitable planet with stable bodies of liquid water on its surface, like Earth.


HIP 38594 c

HIP 38594 c was discovered by the undefined observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 3.81 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HIP 38594 c is 48.42504 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HIP 38594 c is 7.94 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HIP 38594 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HIP 38594, which contains undefined planets and was discovered by undefined.
